page.title: 01Arlington Court and Estate
page.content: Arlington Court and estate of 3471 acres, was bequeathed to the National Trust by Miss Rasalie chichester in 1949. During the summer months it receives many visitors, anxious to see Miss Chichester's collection, the stables with the carriages and the beautiful parkland. The general public also come in the Winter to watch birds, geese and other winter visitors to the lake. The surrounding country is steep and well wooded with many farms. The small farms have grassland for cattle and sheep. The steep-sided valleys leading to the River Teo and tributary are wooded and very beautiful. There are scattered hamlets where people are tenants of the estate and some are working in the grounds and woodland.
